Thanks Jeffrey, I had done all that.I figured it out... this line in the error log stood out to me:2019-11-11 13:30:54, Error                        Unable to open store at C:\$WINDOWS.~BT\Store\MachineSpecific: Win32Exception:C:\C:\Program Files: The system cannot find the path specified. Notice the double C:\C:\Program Files.  It didn't make sense to me how that was possible, UNTIL I saw a folder in the root of C:\ called %programfiles%.  It looks like an application tried to install itself using the variable, but took it literally.  Windows Setup took the literal name and tried to put it back to the variable value... thus, C:\%programfiles% became C:\C:\Program Files!  I delete it and all is right in the world again!Thanks,Dan
